item.title: Wireless Networks course - Academic Year 2019/2020
item.description: Teaching support for the laboratory part of the course Wireless Networks at the University of Pisa. The “Virtualization Lab” module had the aim of introducing the concepts of virtualization, hypervisors, virtual machines and containerization. In particular, the focus has been put on Docker by describing the Docker architecture and objects, Dockerfile and best practices and Docker Compose. One last section has been devoted to introduce the students to the concepts of cloud computing, Software Defined Networks and Network Function Virtualization. Finally, the Red Hat OpenStack cloud computing platform has been described.

item.title: WindFlow: Efficient Continuous Data Stream Processing with Parallel Building Blocks
Accelerating real-world streaming applications with Data Stream Processing frameworks
Implementing Data Stream Processing Applications with the WindFlow library
Accelerating real-world streaming applications with Data Stream Processing frameworks
Master's Thesis [2019] - Benchmarking Data Stream Processing Frameworks on Multicores
WindFlow
Parallel and Distributed Systems (paradigms and models)
item.description: C++ and FastFlow implementation of the parallel scan Blelloch algorithm with a master-worker architecture schema and tests.

item.title: Programming Tools for Parallel and Distributed Systems
item.description: Collection of exercises on MPI, TBB and OpenCL. In particular, a C++ implementation of the Mandelbrot set computation using the Intel Threading Building Blocks library has been implemented.

item.title: Networks and Technologies for Telecommunications - FPGA part
item.description: Implementation of Adders, Subtractors and Multipliers in Verilog HDL. The tests have been conducted on both the Quartus University Program Waveform Simulator and on the DE2-115 series FPGA board.

item.title: Networks and Technologies for Telecommunications - SDN part
item.description: Portion of an In-Band Telemetry application to monitor the latency of packets traversing a certain path/tunnel established between two switches. Programming language/framework: Java, P4, P4 Runtime, ONOS, Mininet.

item.title: Packet Switching and Processing Architectures
item.description: C++ monitoring application that captures traffic with libpcap and identifies and analyses different flows.

item.title: Advanced Software Engineering
item.description: Collection of exercises on web services, business process modeling and containerization with Docker.

item.title: Advanced Programming
item.description:
Collection of four projects:

  • OCaml Domain Specific Language for a Software Defined Network model and a simulation of the behavior of the network.
  • Python API for a Software Defined Network model and a simulation of the behavior and state of the network.
  • Multiset data structure implemented in Java using different concurrency policies.
  • Simple Scala IRC-style chat program.

item.title: Bachelor's Thesis [2016] - Programming Techniques for FPGA Devices
Network Management
item.description: Lua script that monitors system events with Sysdig to measure the performance of an application and the amount of resources required.

item.title: Programming Languages 2
item.description:
Collection of two projects:

  • OCaml implementation of an interpreter for a functional language.
  • Java project oriented to programming by contract approach.

item.title: Computer Networks
item.description: Java implementation of a distributed chat system where users in a WAN can register and exchange messages with each others. The architecture of the application is composed by a Java RMI registry, a server, a set of user agents that manage the requests inserted by connected users, a set of proxies that manage the messages addressed to offline users.
